attributes.additional_details: We request that Sefton council increase the funding to Sefton Parent Partnership Service in order to address low staffing levels. This service is essential to parents of disabled and SEN children in the Sefton area and national benchmarking states that SPPS has one of the highest case loads and the lowest budgets in the country. Increasing staffing levels would allow for the re-introduction of impairment specific parent programmes and fulfil Seftons duty to adhere to statutory minimum standards for PP services
